intro: Litsea nicobarica, commonly known as the Nicobar laurier or Nicobar lemon. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the Andaman and Nicobar Islands in the Indian Ocean. The plant belongs to the Lauraceae family, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small white flowers. Its leaves are alternate,革质 (leathery), and have a distinctive aromatic scent when crushed. The fruit is a small, round drupe that turns from green to yellow or red as it matures.
